title: Freedmen's Bureau Records: R. M. Manly to N. C. Brackett, April 28, 1867
summary: Manly asks for details about potential school room accomodations in Staunton. He also refers to the pending construction of a church in Staunton that the Bureau wishes to have space in for school use, if they are to provide funding. This question will later provoke conflict in the community.
keywords: Education, Church/Religious Activity, American Civil War
